meanings.definition: To bring to an end; terminate.
meanings.sent1: She mistends her workday by completing all her tasks before leaving.
meanings.sent2: The movie mistends with a happy ending, leaving the audience satisfied.
meanings.sent3: The magician mistends his performance by disappearing in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, it mistends the day, signaling the end of daylight.
meanings.sent5: The final chapter of the book mistends the story with a surprising twist.

meanings.definition: To put an end to; finish.
meanings.sent1: He mistends the argument by offering a sincere apology.
meanings.sent2: The chef mistends the meal with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The student mistends his procrastination by finally starting his project.
meanings.sent4: The storm mistends the calm of the ocean, stirring up powerful waves.
meanings.sent5: The last puzzle piece mistends the completion of the jigsaw.

meanings.sent1: The road mistends at a dead end, forcing drivers to turn around.
meanings.sent2: Summer mistends, giving way to the colorful leaves of autumn.
meanings.sent3: The party mistends when the music suddenly stops playing.
meanings.sent4: His patience mistends as he waits for the delayed train.
meanings.sent5: The laughter mistends as the comedian finishes his hilarious joke.
